data.title: GDPrettyPrint is an empty class
data.body:
I've found that GDPrettyPrint is a completely empty class. What was it meant to be, and should we implement it, or remove it?
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/gdscript/gd_pretty_print.cpp
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/gdscript/gd_pretty_print.h

data.title: Slow game for Vehicle simulation 3d in some start
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
manjaro linux 64, drivers ati open

**Issue description (what happened, and what was expected):**
In some cases the game go slow if I use the vehicle simulation

**Steps to reproduce:**
create vehicle and terrain and load scene, the bug generate randomly If you play a game, the important is that the bug start from the beginning of played session, the game go incredibly slow.

**Link to minimal example project (optional but very welcome):**

data.title: Cannot scale VehicleBody
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Linux 4.4.1 64 bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Created VehicleBody object in editor and applied scale. Scale and position are ignored during run time.

Expected behavior:
Scale and position is maintained during run time.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a VehicleBody object and apply scale via the editor.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
http://git.bragafvl.com/masonjoyers/race-game/tree/4315c2c5ec6ae45450c8ff8dcddaeda2afc4ef8b

data.title: The phrase "q0" is highlighted as a keyword in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Typing "q0" in your script gets it highlighted in yellow even though it's not a keyword.

**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: Upon opening a project to edit the "Fix Dependencies" dialog appears and claims
data.body:
Likely related to: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3794

Also quoting my own post from there just for completion:

> Still having this issue with the 2.0 official release/build and .scn files on Windows 7 64 bit.
> PS. My projects folder is on drive E: and godot is 'installed' to drive D: in case this might make any difference.
> 
> ![godoterrorloading](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3162126/13362608/2984dbb6-dcce-11e5-8400-1c4e6377cbc0.png)
> 
> ![godotfixdeps](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3162126/13362544/e0601108-dccd-11e5-8cf7-4ed168ff6506.png)
> Whats really bizarre: All those files are exactly where the paths indicate. They shouldn't even be 'broken'!
> 
>  `core/io/resource_format_binary.cpp:434 - Couldn't load resource: res://GUI/Themes/Fonts/CinzBitmap16.fnt`

**Operating system or device:**
Windows 7 64 Bit Running godot 2.0 release build downloaded from godotengine.org.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Error Loading: dialog opens, reporting files as missing even though they are exactly where the corresponding paths indicate.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. open godot
2. select project(included below) and click 'edit'
3. 'profit!'

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[test1.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/148894/test1.zip)

data.title: Parser bug.. (a extends !b extends c)
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**

Linux 64-bit (with KDE)

Should be reproducible on any operating system.

---

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

While typing a complex expression with the "extends" operator, I accidentally entered something of the sort of: (That's the minimal way to reproduce it)

``` gdscript
func _ready():
    if a extends !b extends c:
        pass
```

To which, godot responded by highlighting the line in red, and displaying `error(26,0): Parser bug..`
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/13364832/ed9571e0-dcd9-11e5-85ee-212e22490300.png)

---

**Steps to reproduce:**
Type in a GDScript file:

``` gdscript
func test_func():
    var x = a extends !b extends c
```

---

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

Steps are simple enough :wink:

data.title: GDScript editor erases any unsaved changes when window regains focus
data.body:
I'm running into a major bug with scripts on 64-bit Windows in the Steam version of Godot.

If you make a change in a script and change focus to another window without saving the script, upon regaining focus the editor seems to reload the script from disc and you lose any changes you've made.

data.title: Thumbnails not generated for .tscn format
data.body:
I have recently started using the .tscn format instead of .scn in the stable v2.0 and noticed that there are no thumbnails being generated for this format like there are for .scn files.

![tscn_thumbnail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7741669/13344189/e009677a-dca7-11e5-8fa5-57e789c2ff4a.png)

data.title: Project directory scan hang / crash when missing execution bit
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**

Linux 64-bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Scan (or Auto-scan) a directory for projects, Godot will either crash with no console output, or hang.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Launch Godot and scan a directory. It will crash or hang (I've experienced both) if the user running Godot lacks the eXecute permission to any subdirectory of the chosen directory to scan.

For instance:

mkdir -P /home/user/projects/test
chmod 666 /home/user/projects/test
or
chown root.root /home/user/projects/test
chmod 700 /home/user/projects/test

Now, launch Godot and try to scan /home/user/projects - Godot will hang or crash.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

N/A

data.title: Touchscreen button emulation does not work as expected with popups.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
xubuntu 14.04 64-bit and a few android tablets for testing with real touchscreen.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Make sure that Project Settings -> emulate_touchscreen -> is set ON

This code works properly, popup shows:

```
func _on_Button_pressed(): 
> get_node("FileDialog").popup()
```

This does not work when tested on the computer (at least under Linux). When clicking the touchscreenbutton with mouse, the FileDialog does not pop up.

```
func _on_TouchScreenButton_pressed(): 
> get_node("FileDialog").popup()
```

However when run on android it properly pop's up the FileDialog, like expected. 
So the qestion is why does is not pop up on a computer (at least in linux).

What may be interesting

```
func _on_TouchScreenButton_released(): 
> get_node("FileDialog").popup()
```

works fine on computer on releasing the mouse button, FileDialog popup shows.

Of course Button and TouchScreenButton nodes have to be set accordingly.
I know it is reproducible. People on IRC channel confirmed.

data.title: Avoiding case switches (GDScript code)?
data.body:
This is more of a request in order to make a better-looking code, at least on [GDScript's part](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/master/modules/gdscript).

The question can be read as either "Avoiding case switches?" or "Writing code with inlining on?" since they're related as I'll explain.

I understand the use of case switches: it's in order to generate a jump table (just as the comments suggest). However, I'm not sure what's the objective behind it, unless to get an algorithmic complexity of O(1), to which I say that [jump tables do not imply that we have O(1) lookup](http://stackoverflow.com/a/1837986/4103007) (source to be thoroughly verified, although it's what I also learned from data structures class).  
Even if we do get instant lookup, the code is a far cry from being good-looking (read "maintainable").

Instead of using them, at least in some instances, it's best to use an array of constant function pointers. I was going to start writing this and send a PR but I lack the knowledge to turn on inlining (or add -finline-functions to CFLAGS) with the current `scons` setup.

If you prefer using case switches for these cases (no pun intended), I'll drop this subject.

data.title: Flashing tooltip in editor
data.body:
OS/version: Windows10 64bit/Godot2.0stable

This is a duplicate issue, but the previous one has been closed
(https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1959).
I posted on reddit to see if anyone else was still having this issue and got a confirmation
(https://www.reddit.com/r/godot/comments/47lwv0/anyone_else_having_this_issue_with_the_ui_tooltip/).

The tooltip seems to flash on and off when you hover your cursor over a ui element. Also the wheel in the top-right corner of the editor ticks every time the tooltip flashes on or off. I haven't noticed this problem in any other application i've used on this system.

data.title: Add Soft Particle to blend particle's edges
data.body:
One of the thing that "kills" the immersion in godot is Hard edge for particles.
Sadly there is no way to smooth the edges of particle when they intersect the geometry :(.

It would be very usefull to have an option in particle emitter to enable this (since for mobile it would be probably way too expensive).

I included a screenshot to illustrate the effect

![windows-live-writer-improved-particle-rendering_b00e-soft-particles_4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6406045/13331768/59eddc14-dbff-11e5-95bb-bb519d8f4925.jpg)

data.title: expose md5 for file(s) to gdscript
data.body:
Looks a little bit dirty.
When the file is open you still have to pass the path. I can't find any variable that is saving the path of the currently open file.

Current version.

```
var f = File.new()
var md5 = f.get_md5("/path/to/file")
```

Alternatives:
1.Bad because you always have to open the file first.

```
var f = File.new()
f.open("/path/to/file")
var md5 = f.get_md5()
```

2.Maybe the static way is the best?

```
var md5 = File.get_md5("/path/to/file")
```

Closes #3820

data.title: ConfigFile should handle errors in such a way that we can continue loading when they occurs
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Referring to this question: http://godotengine.org/qa/331/how-would-i-handle-errors-when-loading-using-configfile

Calinou mentioned I could post it as an issue. I hope we can implement something that allows us to "continue" looking for keys and values even after an error has occurred to prevent complete shutdown when looking for keys and values underneath a bad line. :)

Since they are posted on separate lines; perhaps it will be possible to add exception handling for each line, but allow it to continue search for key&value even when an error has occurred.

data.title: Brackets and quotes should wrap around selected word in the script editor
data.body:
This is an idea to improve the script editor.
If we select a word on the editor and type any of these symbols
' " ( { [ 
the selected text is replaced by these symbols.

It will be good if the behaviour is like those in sublime or atom editor. The word will be wrapped around with the symbol and it's closing symbol.

data.title: GridMap editor: pick up tile from map
data.body:
If you have a large tileset, it can sometimes be hard to find the exact tile you are looking for in the list at the left. Sometimes it would be much easier if you could select a tile you already used somewhere else in the map and start using it.

This could be done with Shift+Clicking or some other key while hovering above the tile you want to use.

data.title: Favourites are project-specific
data.body: Favourites set in the file manager doesn't carry over from project to project. Very annoying as I have to add the same directories in every new project I start.

data.title: feature request: Support for YARN (port yarn spinner to godot)
data.body:
Here's an awesome interactive dialogue/story editor:
https://github.com/InfiniteAmmoInc/Yarn
What is yarn?
Dialogue editor created for "Night in the Woods" (and other projects) by @NoelFB and @infinite_ammo with contributions from @seiyria and @beeglebug. It is heavily inspired by and based on the amazing Twine software: http://twinery.org/
It's written in html5, multiplatform, awesome and open source!

It exports to json files. Currently they have a c# parser for unity.
It is called yarn spinner. Here is some documentation on what it does - the syntax in yarn:
https://github.com/thesecretlab/YarnSpinner/blob/master/Documentation/Usage.md

 I wish I had enough experience to write a gdscript parser. This is pretty darn awesome and makes it very easy to make interactive stories.

I have contacted yarn's developers and opened an issue at their tracker too:
https://github.com/thesecretlab/YarnSpinner/issues/24

Unity can read yarn created json files and turn them into an interactive story - not only dialogues but also writing values and executing functions through the parser - thanks to yarn spinner.

Godot could too - if someone ports yarn spinner to gdscript.
Once implemented it can make story type rpg/adventure game development in godot much more accessible! Using yarn to write interactive dialogue and story is a breeze, and it is very very powerful!

data.title: Ability to copy text from Search Help to OS Clipboard
data.body:
If you look in Search Help you will notice you are able to select text but if you Meta+C or any other possible copy shortcut nothing gets copied to OS Clipboard. At least this is the case for the latest 2.0 on OSX.

You can copy paste text to OS clipboard from Godot Script Editor just not from Search Help.

data.title: Strange HTTPClient error
data.body:
This is the solution I found to read a Body, this version seem to be very slow.

```
        var rb = RawArray() 
        while(http.get_status()==HTTPClient.STATUS_BODY):
            http.poll()
            OS.delay_usec(100) # <- this also helps in some cases 
            var chunk = http.read_response_body_chunk() # <-- creates the error
            if(chunk.size()==0):
                #OS.delay_usec(100) <- no difference
                pass
            else:
                rb = rb+chunk
```

I made another solution that looks a lot faster.

```
        var rb = RawArray() 
        while(http.get_status()==HTTPClient.STATUS_BODY):
            http.set_read_chunk_size( http.get_response_body_length() )
            rb += http.read_response_body_chunk() <-- creates the error
```

At first I thought it is my version that is causing this error but I tried the slow version and it also happens. I am not 100% sure that this line is creating the error but the prints show that it is this line.

ERROR: resize: Condition ' mem.is_locked() ' is true. returned: ERR_LOCKED
   At: core/dvector.h:364.

The frequency of this error depends on the body size. When it is too small I get errors When it is too big I get errors.

(chunk_size == body_size)

```
var chunk_size = 1450000 #OK
var chunk_size = 1000000 #ERRORS
```

Is there a way to solve this?

Ubuntu 64-bit

data.title: Fixed closing a scene tab when it was not the CURRENT tab. Fixes #3810
data.body: Yes, it was that simple.

data.title: Creature 2d animation runtime support
data.body:
Creature2d is a cheap, but much more powerful alternative to Spine2d and Spriter.
http://creature.kestrelmoon.com/
It offers procedural animation, smooth deformations and many other features. What is better - the author of the application has shown big initiative in helping game engines implement it in the past.
He has stated if somebody helps him out, he will add the runtime:
http://www.kestrelmoon.com/creatureforum/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=244

There is also already a c++ implementation:
http://www.kestrelmoon.com/creaturedocs/Game_Engine_Runtimes_And_Integration/Custom_Engine_C++_Runtimes.html

I hope to see this available in godot for a number of reasons:
- creature has a much more powerful animation editor than godot or spriter. It supports smooth deformations!
- It's license is cheaper than spriter and especially much cheaper than spine2d (rip off!)
- Once implemented - it's likely that creature's main developer will keep it up to date and take care of it.

data.title: Need to occlude NavigationPolygon set in TileSet at runtime
data.body:
NavigationPolygon can be added to a Tileset to mark a tile to be used by Navigation2d to find a path.
While building your Tilemap, each tile have static data of navigation to be considered by pathfinding.

Problem: If you an extra layer of object that have to be avoided by Navigation2d pathfinding, how can you do?

Is it possible to have this improvment to 2d pathfinding?
